text: Shared at muckfest by hopscotch. The beer is a hazy yellow with a white head of foam. Juicy citrus notes with a floral and citrus tartness throughout the aroma. Huge sourness in the taste. Medium body and medium carbonation. What the fuck is Sudachi?
Bottle courtesy of Paul. Pours a super hazy body with soft lace. Nose is sour lime and lactic character. Mouthfeel is medium to light bodied with notes of sour tart pomelo, sour limeade and salt.
Mbcc red. Pale yellow hazy. Citrussy, lemongrassy, sharpy nice nose. Lightish bodied, sparkly prickly. Sharp citrussy flavour. Nice. Refreshing clean.
Sampled at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Hazy lemon yellow pour with a white head. Notes of lemons, lime, light tequila spices. Light and refreshing, really nice!
Tap @MBCC2017, Red Session. Cloudy yellow, white head. Fresh sudachi aroma. Juicy, bitter flavour. Fruity citrusy, mostly lemon and lime.

Tap. Hazy pale yellow body with a small white head. Aroma of lemon, grapefruit, lime zest and funky notes. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up being dry and somewhat tart. Light bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Berliner indeed. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ

Sampled @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration 2017, Red Session. TrÃ¼bes hell goldgelbes Bier. Geruch nach limetten, grapefruit, GewÃ¼rze, mild sÃ¤uerlich. Geschmack nach grapefruit, limetten, spritzig sÃ¤uerlich.

dyft: frisk krydret citrus lime lidt Ã¦bleskral
smag: frisk krydret peber lime tÃ¸r eftersmag
Tap at MBCC2017, Copenhagen. Color is cloudy yellow with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Citrus, tartness, spices and some sweetness.

(On tap @ CBC 2016 Red Session, Copenhagen) Pours hazy yellow-gold with a white head. Aroma of tart aromatic citrus (yuzu, lime) and conifers, subtly peppery, lactic sourness, light wheat. Flavour is pretty sour lactic citrus, lemon-lime juice with bitter, aromatic zest, yuzu, pine needles, floral, a bit spiced. Acidic, cleansing citrus finish. Medium body, average carbonation. Nice, refreshing stuff, the sudachi complements and fleshes out the usual citrus of a Berliner.

On tap @ TÃ¸rst. So thirsty right about now. This is one amazing smelling beer! Oh, my this is nice! Sweet and super fruity nose. ItÂ’s like some sort of smoothie with lime, lemonade, wheat and all sorts of berries. Absolutely stunning aroma! Looks like it should with a really cloudy yellowish peachy golden body and a small quickly sidesticking head. The drinkability on this is as high as the aroma suggested. Mild lemonic tart, lots of nice berries. ItÂ’s not thin or watery at all for the relatively low abv. Amazing quencabillity, and IÂ’m almost convinced myself now that a good Berliner Weisse on a hot day perhaps is my favorite beer genre. Lovely. 12.06.2015

On draft at Mermaid Tavern. The pourbusba foggy golden yellow with a thin white ring of head and a little hit of a soapy lace as it falls down. The aroma is fantastic. ItÂ’s tart, crisp, clean, and fruity. ItÂ’s got a nice cactus kind of pineyness. ItÂ’s like a pine tree had a citrus fruit. I have no idea what a sudachi fruit is, but this smell amazing. ItÂ’s a little wheaty, which is why I knocked it. The flavor is much of the same. Tart and sour fruit with a hint of wheat and a beautiful sweetness throughout. The citrus and pine are crazy. I love it. The mouth feel is crisp and clean with a bright carbonation and a lingeringly tart fruit and some wheat on the back end. This is just fantastic! Shit.
New beer #3 at EBF. Draft. Golden pour with white head. Light spice, fruit, grapefruit and tart aromas. Flavors are tart, mildly sweet, a touch of pepper and citrus notes.
CBC2015, Pours pale yellow with a small head, aroma of fruits, black pepper, lemon, grapefruit, flavor is fruity with grapefruit, black pepper, yogurt, medium bodied
Draught. Yellow coloured. Hazy. Dense white head. ARoma. Sourness, citrus, fruits. Flavour. Frutis, sourness, lemon, citrus. Quite tart and acidic. Medium to full bodied. Ends sour and acidic.
On tap at CBC 2016, yellow session. Pours hazy golden yellow, white head. Citrus, fruity, lemon, wheat, bit lactic. Moderate acidity, light bodied.

Aroma and taste is medium sour citrus fruity with notes of lemon, yeast, yuzu, wheat, light floral hoppy, fruity finish.
Sample at CBC 2016. Tart smell, fruity with citrus. art taste with citrus, lime, lime juice and lemons. Refreshing.
Draft. A hazy yellow beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of fruit and wheat. The flavor is a bit acidic with notes of wheat, fruit, and straw, leading to a tart finish.

Red session, Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Hazy pale golden beer with a nice white head. Sourish sudachi aroma, orange zest, floral, some grapfruit. Sourish sudachi flavor, grapefruit, herbal, floral notes, some spices.
Tap@ CBC 2016. Pale golden color, thin white head. Sweet fruity, ripe fruits. Some harshness. Tart/sweet fruits.

Pours milky citrus with low white head 
Aromas tart citrusy, spices, zesty lemon 
Taste has notes of zesty lemon, tart grapes, hints of vanilla , spices

Draught @ CBC 2016, Copenhagen. Pours cloudy yellowish with a smooth head. Aroma of lemon soda, citrus and tartness. Taste is slightly lactic sour with some pear and lemon. Finish is smooth and slightly sourish. Interesting.

On tap @ CBC 2016. Hazy milky white body, small white head. Nose is grapefruit, citrus juice, lemon zest and hints of lactic sour notes and lemon zest. Taste is grapefruit, lemon zest, wheat, grains and hints of grape peel and wood glue. Light body, high carbonation. Decent, but a bit unclean in the fermentation it seems.
Draft from Hunahpu Â’16: murky yellow, bright white head. aroma of lemon, spice, grass. tastes are wheat, lemon, citric, herbal, grapefruit, floral. moderate tart level. nice.

On tap at CBC 2015. Pours a hazy pale yellow with a small white head. Quite bitter with a medium sourness. Lots of aromas of grapefruit and cucumber. Medium to full bodied. Medium to soft carbonation. Bitter finish.

Draft pour on tap at Hunah Hangover Day 2016 (Dunedin, FL). Pours a hazy straw yellow hue, natural applesauce with a firmer lucid glow and bigger creamy whitish head atop. Sizable, good retention and lacing overall. Aromas are tart, dusty, and a bit dry. Some nice lactic twang, kiwi and citric appeal with yogurt, a dustiness to it. Initial is dry and puckering, a firmer sourness is tempered by that odd sudachi fruit addition, almost a bit bitter and green, not unlike kiwi or starfruit I think. A touch bitter but clean, dry overall with a firmer supporting sourness. Unique stuff almost moving into that dryhop sour sort of realm into the backend and finish.
Tap @ CBC 2015. Memory on fleek. Pours clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma and taste of citrus, yuzu, wheaty, lactic, lemony.

[emailÂ protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Hazy yellowish golden colour with a mediumsized white head. Aroma is zest, some vanilla, sugar and mild lactic notes. Flavour is lactic, some lemon, mild sourness to it as well as some mild matiness. A bit thin, and also quite straight forward without all too much complexity.
Tasted during beer trip through Florida. Only numerical ratings were recorded during this trip.

Draught at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015. Light hazy hay liquid with a medium white head. Aroma of yuzu, lemon peel, vanilla and sugar. Taste is dry and light to medium sour with notes of lemon and yuzu. Light to medium bodied with medium carbonation. One-dimensional but nice.

Draft shared during RBWG. Thanks to the 7venth Sun Crew! Hazy light yellow pour with a small white head. Massive lemon and lime on the nose. Attention grabbing stuff. Mild aromatic grassiness. Taste is bright and fantastic. Plenty of lemon/lime. Nice juicy tart character. Mellow salt and wheaty funk. Very flavorful. Light and nimble. Crushable. Great stuff!

CBC. Unclear yellow with no head. Aroma is malt, yeast, baking yeast, lemon, lime and a little artificial. Aroma is malt, yeast, baking yeast, yozu?, little dry, little sweet, little acid and a little artificial.

Draught @ CBC 2015 [ Blue Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015, Sparta Hallen, Gunnar Nu Hansens Plads 11, 2100 Copenhagen, Denmark [ As 7venth Sun Do You Even Sudachi Bro? ].Hazy matt medium yellow color with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, pale mal - wheat, grapefruit - zest - lime. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate acidic with a long duration, zest, grapefruit, dry, tart. Body is medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. [20150501]

On tap at CBC15. Cloudy yellow with a reddish tint, white head. Aroma has loads of lemon, nice tart lactic notes, more lemon, fruit, grapefruit and spice. Taste is tart, lemony, lactic, grapefruit with high bitterness. Really pleasant!

[5/1/15] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015. 2nd session. Cloudy pale pinkish yellow. Great aroma, lactic, citric, full of red grapefruit. Sour-bitter flavor with red grapefruit and lacto. Medium-bodied. Lovely.
Draught at CBC2015. Cloudy yellow - white head. Peppery. Spicy. Grape fruity. Light malty. Pear. Zesty. Acid. Sharp fruity - in a pleasant way. Lovely.

Draught @ CBC 2015, Blue Session, KÃ¸benhavn
Pours hazy milky golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, citrus, grape and juice. Taste is light sweet and medium sour with a long grapefruity, sour and dry finish. Body is light to medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.
From tap at CBC 2015. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of sourness, citric, citrus, herbs and yuzu.

Pours a hazy yellow with a small, soapy head. Aroma has loooots of lemon! Lemon curd, lemon grass, spices like coriander, tart, fruity, juicy and yummi! Taste is nice and tart, but with a slight sweetness, again a little like lemon curd. Really nice and juicy and awesome balance. Medium high carbonation and light, juicy body. Yes please!
From tap. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is solid lime and citric. Lingering lime and citric. Smooth fruity. Mild fruity and mellow fruity finish.
Tap @ CBC 2015, blue session. Hazy bright golden pour with some head. Loads of citrus fruits, lemon limes and orange. Tasty, nice and refreshing!
CBC. Unclear pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, heavy lime and tart. Flavor is quite sweet and light sour. Dry and light sour finish. 010515

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2015 Tap cbc15. Purs hazy yellow with regular white head. Aroma hits you with lime, tropical fruits, orange, lactic sourness. Taste is so damn fruity! Lime, citrus, orange, its like liquid lemon drops! Lactic sourness and citrusy tang. Some body due to the wheat.

Tap @ CBC 2015. Pours bright yellow with a white head. Aroma of massive citrus notes, tropical fruits, salt, yuzu, sweet orange and herbs. Nice! The taste has nice sweet citrus, floral notes, herbs, weak salt, orange and some lactic sourness.

Draught at CBC 2015.
Hazy yellow coloured with a small white head.
Fruity and light acidic aroma of citrus and yuzu.
Fruity and acidic flavour f citrus, yuzu and lemon juice.
Tart finish.
Sample at CBC 2015. Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma and taste of grapefruit, tart, lime.

Draught @ CBC 2015. Pours hazy pale yellow with a huge white head. Aroma of wheat, tartness, salt, cucumber, tart fruit, citrus, lime. Flavor is tart, wheat, fruity, citrus, lime. Thin body, average carbonation, tart fruity finish. 010515

Sample at CBC 2015.

Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma and taste of grapefruit, sour fruit, light bread and some grass. Light mouthfeel and with a sour finish. A descent one.
Tap @ CBC, 2015. Pours Hazy yellow with a white head. Lemon and lime. Citrus peel. Raw and one dimensional. Thats it!
Pours hazy pale yellow with low white head. Aroma of flowers, citrus, grapefruit. Taste is grapefruit bitter with, yeah, grapefruit bitter finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation.
Tap at CBC15... Hazy yellow amber... Thin white lacing... Soft sharp zezty yuzu fruits nose.. Soft sharp tart lime juice.. Nice
on tap at 7th sun pours a hazy yellow with a white head .amazing beer in warm weather. orange grapefruit lemon lime taste.

Wow this was amazing. One of the best beers I had a Huna day 15. Hazed yellow, white head. Sour and juicy as hell. Loads of sour oranges, tangerines, ruby grapefruit, lemon, lime, buddhas hand. Hell yes.

Appearance: A rather well-clouded, pale straw colored body with a light, white head.

Smell: Eye-openingly vibrant authentic tropical citrus aroma.

Taste: ItÂ’s the same with the taste - bright, inviting lemon-lime flavor, a tad tart but also a tad floral with a skosh of sweetness. Nil hop character, bitterness. Soft, gently drying finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-thin body. Moderate carbonation.

Overall: Delightful. Why, itÂ’s like a cup of freshly-squeezed juice in the morningtime.

Draft at 7venth Sun during the RBWG 2015 bus tour. Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of black pepper, spice, tropical fruit. Tastes of lemon, tropical fruit, tart grapefruit. Medium body with a dry finish. Tasty.
Draft. Pours yellow gold. Nose/taste of lime, grapefruit, light sour lemon, funk and lactose. Lighter medium body. Bright and awesome.

2/20/15. On tap at the brewpub RBWG 2015. Hazy golden pour with a nice khaki head. Great aroma - a boatload of lime, a hint at some pepper, tartness. Sour flavor, lime juice, mild pepper. Tasty in small doses.

On draft at 7venth. Pours a hazy yellow with a white head. Nose is extreme white grapefruit, unripe citrus, some kumquat, some tartness, and some bready wheat. Flavor is exactly what I want in a Florida Weisse: mildly tart, big fruit presence, white grapefruit, unripe citrus, some orange peel, and some kumquat. Light in body and delicious overall.

Keg at the brewery tap during RBWG Â’15, 20/02/15.
Hazed light orange to yellow with a moderate off white covering.
Nose carries a massive citric zing, lime jus, light salt, lemon rind.
Tastes tangy as fuck, bitter orange, tangerine, nectarine, pink grapefruit.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with light acidity and plenty of puckerings.
Great stuff - tarte and sharp in the execution.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Draft at the source, RBWG 2015. Absolutely gorgeous aroma of fresh lime flowers and perfume. Taste is an interesting mix of bitter and sour citrus. Delicious.

Wowzers, poured a light cloudy yellow color with aromas of tart citrus, grapefruit and fresh hops. Flavors were crisp citrus and light grapefruit nice tartness a touch if lemon. Light and refreshing put a jolt in my palate to wake me up.
Pours light hazy yellow with no head. Aroma is bright orange peel, grapefruit and lime. Taste follows, sour citrus, wheat and funk. Very bright and citrusy.
Draft - Bright grapefruit citrus, tart and sour. Cloudy yellow with a thin white head. Bright yellow grapefruit, tart, sour and a bit peppery and some pith. Very nice and refreshing.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a intense key lime and lacto. Thin mouthfeel with strong lime and fruit, nice tartness, very nice.

Draft at the brewery during RBWG 2015. Pours lightly hazed pink-gold with a foamy white head. Smells good, like fresh grapefruit. Light sweet avor, tart, drying, a little spicy, with suggestions of tangerine and grapefruit. Light bodied with fine carbonation. Dry on the finish with fleshy grapefruit, white pepper. Unique and quite tasty.

4oz on tap at the brewery. Hazy amber orange color, totally opaque. Thin ring of white head, leaves decent ropes and ridges of lace. Fantastic big grapefruit-like nose. Love it. Lighter body. Smooth, kind of soft, lighter carbonation. Light dry finish. Nice moderate tart taste, light sweet, incredible fruity finish... I donÂ’t think IÂ’ve ever had a sudachi, but this is kind of like a tropical grapefruit. Love this.
